intro: Eschweilera jarana, commonly known as the Jarana tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree is characterized by its large, broad leaves and produces showy, cream-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in lowland and montane forest habitats, thriving in humid, shaded environments. The plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
